title: Pull request merge from SylvainLan/nilearn:fix_canICA to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: LGTM. Merging
Also, you forgot to add bounds in the ```threshold``` parameter documentation. From the issue, if I get correctly threshold should be between [0. and n_components]
You should also add tests to check whether error is raised or not. Tests should be added in nilearn/decomposition/tests/test_canica.py

>Also, you forgot to add bounds in the threshold parameter documentation. From the issue, if I get correctly 
threshold should be between [0. and n_components]

May be it would be good idea to put threshold bound [0. and n_components] near the description of float value. Right after non-zero voxels). .......

>You should also add tests to check whether error is raised or not. Tests should be added in nilearn/decomposition/tests/test_canica.py

Could you add tests please ?

From the doc, the given threshold can be None, 'auto' or float. Here, you should also check that the given threshold should be a ```numbers.Number``` to raise an error. Also, in Python I think we don't need parenthesis.

text:
Attempts to FIX,

 - CircleCI failure particularly with timedout errors where every PR is failing on this.

- To make it a faster to build doc.

This was done basically to increase timeout (I don't have better alternative right now) and use parallel=true.
Both changes are made in circle.yml.

It is just an attempt to see CircleCI now. Other suggestions are also welcome.
title: FIX: CircleCI timedout error
